glsa.title: bluez-utils: Bluetooth device name validation vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: Improper validation of Bluetooth device names can lead to arbitrary command execution.

background.p: bluez-utils are the utilities for use with the BlueZ implementation of the Bluetooth wireless standards for Linux.

description.p: The name of a Bluetooth device is improperly validated by the hcid utility when a remote device attempts to pair itself with a computer.

impact.p: An attacker could create a malicious device name on a Bluetooth device resulting in arbitrary commands being executed as root upon attempting to pair the device with the computer.

workaround.p: There are no known workarounds at this time.
